rooms.description: A wide entrance hall with an open layout that leads into the main living areas. This area includes wheelchair-accessible features such as ramps and no-step entry.
A spacious living room with traditional Kerala design elements, including wooden finishes and intricate carvings. It is accessible and provides ample space for gatherings.
An integrated dining area adjacent to the living room, featuring open space design that maintains continuity with other areas. Includes accessible pathways and seating arrangements.
A compact yet efficient kitchen designed for both traditional cooking methods and modern appliances, ensuring wheelchair accessibility with lowered counters and ample maneuvering space.
rooms.notes: Location chosen to adhere to Vastu principles for balance between work area and living spaces.

rooms.description: A dedicated servant's quarter with basic amenities, including a small bathroom and storage. The space is positioned away from the main residence while maintaining privacy.
An inviting library space, designed to be quiet and contemplative with traditional wooden shelving and ambient lighting. It is located in a corner that aligns with Vastu guidelines.
Wheelchair-accessible toilet facilities designed according to building norms and safety regulations, ensuring ease of use for all occupants.

openings.description: Wide entrance door with step-free access; includes a ramp leading to the main living areas.

Strategically placed windows on all levels for natural light and ventilation, designed in keeping with Kerala aesthetics. Windows are larger towards the east and south to maximize daylight based on Vastu principles.
A service entry door for kitchen access and servant quarters, ensuring separate circulation routes.

levels.vastu_alignment: This plan has been designed keeping in mind the Vastu principles, with specific room placements (e.g., library to the north, kitchen in the northeast) and directional alignments for positive energy flow.
levels.accessibility: All rooms and circulation areas are wheelchair accessible, featuring wide doorways, ramps, and no-step transitions where necessary.
